sentences.sContent: But after a while, they move uptown, into the formal economy.
sentences.sContent_eng: But after a while, they move uptown, into the formal economy.
sentences.sCn: 但是不久，他们就搬进住宅区，成为正式经济的一部分。

sentences.sContent: Every Friday, I trek uptown with Audrey to see a child life specialist.
sentences.sContent_eng: Every Friday, I trek uptown with Audrey to see a child life specialist.
sentences.sCn: 每周五，我都要很辛苦地带着奥德丽去住宅区看儿童生活专家。

trans.tranCn: （美）在住宅区；（美）在城镇非商业区
trans.tranOther: in or towards an area of a city that is away from the centre, especially one where the streets have larger numbers in their names and where people have more money
